TopicTitle: Launch tower mod for school project *questionnaire*

Articles.Content:
Hello everyone

i have chosen to create a mod that would be a substitute for the pathetic stability enhancers, with something more realistic like a launch tower.

this mod is also what i'm doing for a school assessment, which is we have to find a solution to a problem or inappropriate solution of a digital entity.

what i would like to ask is if you reckon the current solution (stability enhancers) is a suitable option for the game.

if you wish to place feedback/reply please answer with yes/no and if you wish to leave a reason for your answer that would be great.
I've never had a problem with the launch stability enhancers. I think they work totally fine.

Well, 

like anything in the game could do with a few more customisables: arm length, attachy bit size, but other than that i think they serve very well!

Launch towers aren't needed for stock KSP, cause rockets seem to be teleported to the pad already full of fuel and pilots and payload. Stability enhancers appear to simulate the hold-down arms, but its an unrealistic solution, they are integrated as part of the thrust deflection/ignitor structure. I would love to see a mod replicating an actual launch pad, with a LUT and tower for astronaut access. The rest of the launch pad structure could be a part attached to the rocket during construction!
I believe the original versions of KSP had a launch tower, but it ended up being generally hated (because it was easy to run into during launch) so was removed.

I liked the launch tower though... ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

\*Goes and plays old demo version\* Ah, it's pretty. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I feel like the current clamps are fine. Really, you've just gotta make sure you build your ship so that the clamps can reach. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

The current stock launch clamps perform their jobs well, but they aren't aesthetically pleasing for me. Personally, I prefer something more like the FASA launch clamps- lots of umbilicals, piping, walkways, and trusses.

Since FASA already has some towers like the ones in Saturn V launch, maybe you can try your hands on more exotic ones like the ones the russian uses, where the whole structure fall away:

You COULD make a scaffolding-like larger launch clamps that would look better on the huge craft, but it's not a solution in demand.
